body:
Comment 4: 
> we probably can fix the test by not triggering any race detector hooks.

How can we do it? It means not calling functions and not accessing any heap/global
memory.

> another strange thing is that the test mostly flake on freebsd, but not
linux/darwin/windows.

This can be due to the way I built the runtime. I did not manage to build a fresh
gcc/clang on freebsd, so I used some old default one. So the runtime can be slower on
freebsd.
